radiographic_examinations.findings: Punctate cystic changes in the long tubular bones of the hands and feet, right-sided rotoscoliosis, slight scalloping in the posterior L2-L4 vertebrae, and compact enostosis in the right talus.
Symmetrical increase in brain size with normal ventricles (megalencephaly).
Except for antral gastritis, findings were normal.
Massive gastrointestinal bleeding and hamartomatous polyposis of the colon.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The polyps have been surgically removed and the patient is well at 6-month postoperative follow-up.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Findings of axonal neuropathy; low peroneal compound muscle action potential amplitude; prolongation of the motor unit action potential in the biceps femoris and vastus lateralis muscles. No sign of denervation or interference pathology.
Normal findings, indicating a lack of structural and numerical chromosome abnormalities.
